textList.name: TEXT_GUARD_SIGNAL
textList.text: It appears the guard ship is sending out a distress signal to a nearby ASB platform! Brace for impact!
Scans show the guard has sent a request for backup from an ASB defense system. That can't be good...
You catch chatter on the other ship, mentioning something about a signal requesting for ASB backup! Looks like we might have another hazard to worry about.

event.text: When no ASB activates, you assume that is a good sign that your augment has functioned properly, and you continue to fight.
The captain struggles to keep the ship on track, but the rest of the crew seems to know something is up and keeps the ship on target.
Your mind control proves effective and the guard ship goes silent.
You try to cloak and evade the enemy ship, but their scanners are too good and they lock onto your location!
You try to cloak and evade the enemy ship, but their scanners are too good and they lock onto your location!
You successfully manage to slip past the guard without being noticed.
You attempt to slip past the guard, but they're faster than expected and catch up to you!
You successfully manage to escape from the guard's range.

textList.name: TEXT_START_CIVILIAN
textList.text: You have arrived in a Civilian sector. The Federation's promises to keep these sectors safe has fallen through, and now the civilians have turned to establishing their own militia. We shouldn't see too much trouble here.
You have arrived in a Civilian sector. The civilian-run Militia here is competent enough, but they're a little suspicious of strangers. Keep your Federation ID ready just in case.

event.name: GUARD_CIVILIAN_CRIMINAL
event.text: Something seems off here. Usually, the Militia wouldn't bat an eye at ships like yours, but now, you catch suspicious chatter on the guard ship.
It seems your track record has caught up to you. The guard's crew have heard enough of the crimes you've been committing, and they don't intend to let you into the sector!

event.name: GUARD_CIVILIAN
event.text: The Militia are tasked with protecting this sector, and have instated a guard to prevent unlawful entry to the sector. Luckily, you don't fall into this category.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_GUARD_CIVILIAN_CONTACT
textList.text: A gruff, bearded human captain responds. "Yes, we see you. What do you want?"
A friendly, thin militia-man responds in a chipper tune. "Ah, hello! Always nice to see visitors."
The Militia captain nods in response to your hail, but says nothing. His face bears an inquisitive look.

event.text: Your human sends over their Federation ID, which the Militiamen scan and, once verified, transfer over a crate of supplies.
Your medic calls the Militiamen and requests medical supplies, to which they respond by sending over a Medi-Cluster Bomb and some ammunition for it.

"A Federation soldier! You must be a very important vessel! I'm afraid we have little to give other than this spare Mine Launcher. I've never been a fan of the things myself, but maybe you'll find use in it."

choice.text: Change your mind and leave the guard alone.

event.text: You apologize and end comms. The guard makes no attempts to communicate further.
"I apologize, but we do not have orders to provide assistance to other ships."
The Militiamen agree to your request, and transfer over a small crate of supplies.
The Militia guard refuses to give in to your demands. Instead, they raise their weapons and retaliate with their weapons.
Reluctantly, the Militiamen transfer over some supplies, not wanting to battle you.
The Militia guard refuses to give in to your demands. Instead, they raise their weapons and retaliate with their weapons.
Reluctantly, the Militiamen transfer over some supplies, not wanting to battle you.
Reluctantly, the Militiamen transfer over some supplies, not wanting to battle you.

event.name: GUARD_CIVILIAN_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Militia guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_CIVILIAN_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Militia guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_CIVILIAN_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Militia guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_CIVILIAN

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: A Militia ship moves in to attack! Based on the vengeful look in their captain's eye, this is no doubt the ship dispatched by the guard to hunt you down!

textList.name: TEXT_START_FED
textList.text: You have arrived in Federation space. The Federation may be weakened, but this sector remains fully functional. The Rebellion will struggle to sneak its way into here.
You have arrived in Federation space. Lots of friendly faces will be here, but there will be plenty of Rebel scum invading as well.
You have arrived in Federation space. This may be a sector full of allies, but it is bound to attract plenty of Rebels too.

event.name: GUARD_FEDERATION
event.text: This sector is protected by a Federation guard. Several support ships linger in the background, offering aid to other Federation ships in the district.
The guard's captain is shocked that you've turned on them. "You must be a Rebel spy! We won't take this lightly!"
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

event.name: GUARD_FED_SUPPORT
event.text: The guard puts you on a secure line with one of the nearby support ships, who awaits your command.
Several repair drones are dispatched to repair you.
A refueling drone is dispatched to refuel your ship.
A resupply drone is dispatched to resupply your ship.
A resupply drone is dispatched to resupply your ship.

event.name: GUARD_FED_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Federation guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_FED_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Federation guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_FEDERATION_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Federation guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_FED

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You catch sight of a rare Federation Elite, but they don't seem pleased to see you. "Turncoats! You should be ashamed!" The ship moves in to attack, and it doesn't take long for you to realize this is one of the ships sent by the guards to hunt you down for attacking.

event.name: START_MILITIA
event.text: This sector serves as the base of the Militia's operations. It contains their armouries and fleet, houses their soldiers, and is the place where training exercises are conducted. For pirates or Rebels to penetrate this militarized sector would be an incredible feat, but with your luck you wouldn't be surprised...

event.name: GUARD_MILITIA_CRIMINAL
event.text: Something seems off here. Usually, the Militia wouldn't bat an eye at ships like yours, but now, you catch suspicious chatter on the guard ship.
It seems your track record has caught up to you. The guard's crew have heard enough of the crimes you've been committing, and they don't intend to let you into the sector!

event.name: GUARD_MILITIA
event.text: As to be expected, an Elite Militia guard is protecting the sector to prevent unwanted ships from entering. Luckily, your Federation ID is all you need to get inside.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_GUARD_MILITIA_CONTACT
textList.text: A Zoltan Peacekeeper, not too surprising a sight on a vessel of this calibre, receives your hail and awaits your message.
A squat militiaman accepts your hail, but taps the watch on his wrist. "You have 30 seconds. What do you want?"

event.text: Your human sends over their Federation ID, which the Militiamen scan and, once verified, transfer over a crate of supplies.
Your medic calls the Militiamen and requests medical supplies, to which they respond by sending over a Medi-Cluster Bomb and some ammunition for it.

"A Federation soldier! You must be a very important vessel! I'm afraid we have little to give other than this spare Mine Launcher. I've never been a fan of the things myself, but maybe you'll find use in it."

choice.text: Change your mind and leave the guard alone.

event.text: You apologize and end comms. The guard makes no attempts to communicate further.
"I apologize, but we do not have orders to provide assistance to other ships."
The Militiamen agree to your request, and transfer over a small crate of supplies.
The Militia guard refuses to give in to your demands. Instead, they raise their weapons and retaliate with their weapons.
Reluctantly, the Militiamen transfer over some supplies, not wanting to battle you.
The Militia guard refuses to give in to your demands. Instead, they raise their weapons and retaliate with their weapons.
Reluctantly, the Militiamen transfer over some supplies, not wanting to battle you.
Reluctantly, the Militiamen transfer over some supplies, not wanting to battle you.

event.name: GUARD_MILITIA_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Militia guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_MILITIA_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Militia guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_MILITIA_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Militia guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_MILITIA

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: "There he is, that's the bastard that killed the guard!" An elite Militia vessel approaches, ready to avenge their fallen comrades.

textList.name: TEXT_START_ENGI
textList.text: You have arrived in Engi space. The Mantis have been threatening the Engi core worlds, but you should be able to stock up for your journey.
You have arrived in Engi space. The fall of the Federation has brought tough times for these robotic lifeforms, but they're usually willing to help.
You have arrived in Engi space. Technology has been the center of the Engi race's government for a long time, and they tend to value science over their own families.

event.name: GUARD_ENGI_CRIMINAL
event.text: Something seems off here. Usually, the Engi wouldn't bat an eye at ships like yours, but now, you catch suspicious chatter on the guard ship.
It seems your track record has caught up to you. The guard's crew have heard enough of the crimes you've been committing, and they don't intend to let you into the sector!

event.name: GUARD_ENGI
event.text: Despite being normally peaceful, the Engi don't take lightly to intruders in their sectors. Fortunately for you, the guard here doesn't consider you an intruder and ignores you.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_GUARD_ENGI_CONTACT
textList.text: "Hail has been: received." The Engi await your next message.
A small beep signals that the Engi have received your message and are waiting for what you will say.
"Federation ship has initiated contact. Awaiting further command."

event.text: "Fellow Engi detected. Need for supplies will be: fulfilled."
Your Defender transmits a request for drone supplies over an encrypted channel. The guard obliges and transfers a schematic.

choice.text: (Separatist Crew) Try to liberate the guard.

event.text: "Refusal. Suggestion from criminals counters words of Harmony. Initiating combat procedures." Looks like the Engi didn't take kindly to you insulting the Harmony!

choice.text: Change your mind and leave the guard alone.

event.text: You apologize and end comms. The guard makes no attempts to communicate further.
"Transmission received. Apologies, contents of storage intended for visitors = 0%. Requesting that you do not ask again." You decide not to push your luck.
"Identification of visitor = Federation. Protocol requires supplies are: donated."
"Hostile ship poses unfavourable threat level. Despite this: confidence in current defense = high. Preparing combat mode."
"Levels of hostility are 70% above preference. Cargo will be given in return for keeping lives."
"Violent actions are: detected. Preparing offensive reaction." The guard's weapons spring out of the hull and begin to charge!
You can tell the Engi are struggling over whether to honor their programming or give in to your threat. In the end they cave and transfer some supplies.
You can tell the Engi are struggling over whether to honor their programming or give in to your threat. In the end they cave and transfer some supplies.

event.name: GUARD_ENGI_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Engi guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_ENGI_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Engi guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a drone to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_ENGI_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Engi guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_ENGI

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You notice an Engi ship tailing you at this beacon. Regardless of how hard you try to shake them, they won't back down. This must be one of the ships dispatched to hunt you down after killing the guard. Hurry to the combat stations!

textList.name: TEXT_START_SEPERATIST
textList.text: This was once an Engi Sector, still under the influence of the Harmony. However Separatists have since broken free and taken this sector as their own.

This is no regular Engi Sector. Liberated by the Separatists, the Engi Harmony no longer holds control over the sector. Ever since the Federation publicly refused to aid the Separatist efforts the two factions have remained lukewarm.
You appear to have entered a liberated Engi Sector. It's bound to be filled with Engi Separatists, celebrating their freedom from the Engi Harmony.

event.text: Unlike many other sectors, at the entry beacon here there are no ships in sight. The Separatists like to enjoy individual lives, and feel no need to protect their sector from intruders.

textList.name: TEXT_START_ZOLTAN
textList.text: You've entered Zoltan territory. This species is not renowned for giving anything for nothing, but you can always be assured a fair hearing.
The Zoltan patrol their borders but let you pass when you ID as Federation. Let's hope they won't be so courteous to the Rebels.
You arrive in Zoltan space. From what you have heard they anticipated the coming war and made preparations to hold their borders.
You're far from Federation home space here in Zoltan territory, and it's not clear whether the authorities will have any goodwill remaining. Still, you have to push forward.

event.name: GUARD_ZOLTAN_CRIMINAL
event.text: Something seems off here. Usually, the Zoltan wouldn't bat an eye at ships like yours, but now, you catch suspicious chatter on the guard ship.
It seems your track record has caught up to you. The guard's crew have heard enough of the crimes you've been committing, and they don't intend to let you into the sector!

event.name: GUARD_ZOLTAN
event.text: The Zoltan are a strict race, and it appears they have stationed a guard ship here to protect entry to their sector. They don't seem to show interest in you.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_GUARD_ZOLTAN_CONTACT
textList.text: "We acknowledge your hail. What is it that you seek to accomplish by contacting us?"
The Zoltan captain accepts your hail, but does not speak a word.
A brief message is sent back to your ship in response. "We have received your request for communications. Speak your mind and do not waste our time."

event.text: "A friend. Welcome to our territory, and may you find solace along with these gifts of goodwill."

choice.text: (Monk Crew) Guilt them into giving you some scrap.

event.text: Your Monk gives a long speech about morals and living a life free of sin to the guard. Apparently it works, because the Zoltan crew feels enough guilt for whatever sins they might have committed in the past to pay your monk to free themselves of the weight.
Your Peacekeeper recites some line from the Zoltan code of law that seems to convince the guard to call in a support ship to patch up your hull.

choice.text: (Duskbringer Crew) Give a speech on the Duskbringer code.

event.text: Your Duskbringer cuts no corners, talking in great lengths about Duskbringer's morals. The guard isn't impressed and decides to repel your vessel, not eager to support the cause of your Devotee!

choice.text: Change your mind and leave the guard alone.

event.text: You apologize and end comms. The guard makes no attempts to communicate further.
The Zoltan guard makes no attempt to respond to your hails, and you decide not to try and push your luck further.
"You will be glad to hear not all of your allies' goodwill has dried up. Yes, we will provide some supplies."

event.name: GUARD_ZOLTAN_DEMAND
event.text: "A brash act. It is this rash behaviour that has brought the Federations to their knees. We will no longer support you if you cannot even respect your allies!"
The Zoltan make no attempt to respond to your threats, at least not verbally. Instead, they power up their weapons and move in to attack!
"There is no need for violence, friend. We will give you some supplies as you request, so long as you power down those weapons."

event.name: GUARD_ZOLTAN_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Zoltan guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_ZOLTAN_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Zoltan guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_ZOLTAN_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Zoltan guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_ZOLTAN

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: "Stop right there! You are fugitives of the law, wanted for destruction of this sector's guard ship!" The nearby Zoltan ship moves in to attack.

textList.name: TEXT_START_FREEMANTIS
textList.text: The Free Mantis have no interests in the hive mind of the Mantis community. Allies of the Federation, you will likely find aid on your mission here.

The Free Mantis are a nomadic culture, traveling in small clans of ships. Luckily, they often sympathize with the Federation, and you should find little danger in their wandering tribes. As for other encounters here however, that stands up to debate.
The Free Mantis reside in the outskirts of Zoltan territory, but have not been received well. Hopefully you can find assistance from your Mantis allies, but not have to engage any Zoltan.

event.name: GUARD_FREEMANTIS_CRIMINAL
event.text: Something seems off here. Usually, the Free Mantis wouldn't bat an eye at ships like yours, but now, you catch suspicious chatter on the guard ship.
It seems even the Free Mantis have a limit. Your crimes have caught up to the Free Mantis, and they aren't happy about it.

event.name: GUARD_FREEMANTIS
event.text: The Free Mantis, while disorganized as a group, can all agree that this sector must be kept free of control from the Mantis Hive. As such a guard ship protects this beacon, but they don't disturb you.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_GUARD_FREEMANTIS_CONTACT
textList.text: A young Free Mantis waves to you "Hello! You are Federation! So exciting. I love Federation, so glad see you here."
The Free Mantis struggle at grammar and proper dialect, but the crew on the nearby ship manages to get out an understandable and chipper welcome to you and your crew.
An eager Free Mantis warrior responds, happy to assist with whatever you might need.

event.text: "Yes yes! We help Federation ship in all ways can!"

choice.text: (Free Mantis Crew) Request a warrior come join your crew.

event.text: "You needing soldier? Oh most certainly! I come with you!"

choice.text: (Free Mantis Warlord) Request a warrior come join your crew.

event.text: "Your staff has warlord? Most incredible, Federation truly is place of wonders! I come with you yes, and bringing some supplies too."

choice.text: (Mantis Crew) Request a warrior come join your crew.

event.text: "This Hive Mantis, not one of us! You are traitor, we will kill!"
"Eek! You are Hive ship! You betray us, we kill you now!" It appears the Free Mantis aren't pleased to see a Mantis veteran in their sector...

choice.text: Change your mind and leave the guard alone.

event.text: You apologize and end comms. The guard makes no attempts to communicate further.
"Many apologies, cannot provide supplies. Clan would not appreciate giving away things..."
The Free Mantis gladly give you some supplies, honoured to be of assistance to a Federation vessel.
"Federation never selfish or greedy! You not Federation ship, must be Hive spy! We kill you!"
"You are needing supplies? Most certainly! Please, take all we have! Federation heroes, happy to help." It appears they didn't understand your intentions, but you aren't complaining.
"Federation supposed be hero! You certainly not hero. You shameful, we destroy you and bring heads to true Federation vessel!"
The Free Mantis are confused and afraid as to why you betrayed them, but they oblige and give you some supplies.
The Free Mantis are confused and afraid as to why you betrayed them, but they oblige and give you some supplies.

event.name: GUARD_FREEMANTIS_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Free Mantis guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_FREEMANTIS_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Free Mantis guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. On-board you find a young Free mantis warrior who managed to survive the fight! However, he doesn't seem to realize you're the ones who killed his friends, and offers to work along with your crew. You agree and move on to scrap their hull, oddly enough with your new crew to assist.

event.name: GUARD_FREEMANTIS_FOLLOWUP
event.text: Despite killing the guard, it is unlikely reinforcements will be dispatched to hunt you down. The Free Mantis love the Federation, and you doubt they would go to extra lengths to hunt you.

textList.name: TEXT_START_CRYSTAL
textList.text: Ever since the Crystals re-entered the Galactic stage, they've been attempting to set up colonies wherever they can. It appears one such colony has grown into a full sector, which you have just arrived in.
The Crystals never wanted to leave their secluded sector, but after the invasion of "pioneers" they were forced out. It appears this is one of their newly founded sectors.
The Crystals have been divided ever since they left their Homeworlds. Some have sought out the Federation while others have decided to establish new sectors around the galaxy, such as this one.

event.name: GUARD_CRYSTAL_CRIMINAL
event.text: Something seems off here. Usually, the Crystalline people wouldn't bat an eye at ships like yours, but now, you catch suspicious chatter on the guard ship.
It seems your track record has caught up to you. The guard's crew have heard enough of the crimes you've been committing, and they don't intend to let you into the sector!

event.name: GUARD_CRYSTAL
event.text: The Crystals, while not all that unfriendly, are extremely protective over their newly claimed territory. Because of this, there is no question as to the purpose of the guard here.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_GUARD_CRYSTAL_CONTACT
textList.text: "Hail, foreigners! It is always a great day to see a new face. What is it that you seek?"
"Aliens, hmmm. There was once a time seeing so many new creatures would have come as a shock to me, but no longer. For what is the reason you have hailed us?"
The Crystals accept your message and await your next.

event.text: "So you aren't foreigners after all. Yes, I suppose we can offload some of our cargo to assist. It is a dangerous place, this new galaxy."
"Oh, heavens. Sir, I apologize. I did not recognize you. My apologies, we can most certainly provide a weapon for your mission."

choice.text: Change your mind and leave the guard alone.

event.text: You apologize and end comms. The guard makes no attempts to communicate further.
"Though it's quite interesting to discover new people, I'm afraid we cannot spare any supplies."
"You wish for some supplies? Most certainly! It is not often I get the opportunity to make new friends!"
"You insult our entire species with your demands! We refuse to allow someone such as yourself continue into our sector and wreck havoc!"
"Is it customary here to make such rude demands towards strangers? Disgusting... but we do not wish to have any issues. Take this and be gone."
The Crystals don't take well to your threats. Rather than complying, they raise their guns and attack.
"I was right to assume you troglodytes were not above barbaric savagery! Take these supplies and leave at once."
"I was right to assume you troglodytes were not above barbaric savagery! Take these supplies and leave at once."

event.name: GUARD_CRYSTAL_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Crystal guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_CRYSTAL_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Crystal guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_CRYSTAL_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Crystal guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_CRYSTAL

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: "Outsiders, we knew you were barbaric, but when we migrated here we had no idea you would intrude our sector and threaten our ways with such violent acts! We will avenge our fallen brothers aboard the guard ship you so ruthlessly destroyed!"

textList.name: TEXT_START_ORCHID
textList.text: On your way to escape the Rebel fleet, you jumped into the Orchid sector. Even though they're named by humans after Earth plants, they have little in common with them.
You've entered a sector populated by the reclusive but friendly Orchid race. They don't approve of the violent battles of the Civil War, but they've taken effort to aid the Federation where possible.

event.name: GUARD_ORCHID_CRIMINAL
event.text: Something seems off here. Usually, the Orchids wouldn't bat an eye at ships like yours, but now, you catch suspicious chatter on the guard ship.
It seems your track record has caught up to you. The guard's crew have heard enough of the crimes you've been committing, and they don't intend to let you into the sector!

event.name: GUARD_ORCHID
event.text: Most Orchids don't speak verbally despite their species's capability to. Regardless, they welcome you to the sector with a wave.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_GUARD_ORCHID_CONTACT
textList.text: The Orchid bows, acknowledging your presence, and waits for your next move.
The Orchid speaks briefly to say hello and falls silent once again.

event.text: Though the two Orchids speak no words, they seem to communicate briefly through a flash of their petals and the guard agrees to give some supplies.
The Orchid guard nods after seeing your crew and transfers over a Kernel weapon.

choice.text: Change your mind and leave the guard alone.

event.text: You apologize and end comms. The guard makes no attempts to communicate further.
The Orchid shakes their head, signifying that they have no supplies to spare.
The Orchid nods and the guard transfer over some supplies.
The Orchids aren't a hostile race, but when you come into their sector and start making demands you can expect they're going to retaliate.
The Orchids don't wish to fight. They give over some supplies.
The Orchids aren't a hostile race, but when you come into their sector and start making demands you can expect they're going to retaliate.
The Orchids don't wish to fight. They give over some supplies.
The Orchids don't wish to fight. They give over some supplies.

event.name: GUARD_ORCHID_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Orchid guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_ORCHID_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Orchid guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_ORCHID_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Orchid guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_ORCHID

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You didn't think the Orchids were a particularly vengeful race, but it appears you've driven the ship here to violence by killing the guard, and now they want you dead.

textList.name: TEXT_START_OUTCAST
textList.text: Fortunately for you, the Outcasts have little beef with the Federation or most factions for that matter. The Theocracy prefers to stay clear of this place, instead sending contracted slavers like the Tiiikaka clan as well as occasional Coalition scouts to do its dirty work.

You've heard many stories of the massive ramshackle Outcast camps to be found in these sectors, spanning ranges of territory so large they can compete with modern cities. To mess with them would nearly be a death sentence, but fortunately you doubt they'll mind your presence.

Apparently sectors like these are where the legendary Dread-Pirate Tuco once lived. Now, you can find all kinds of people here. Apparently, even the Crystal Empire has begun sending "liberators" to the Theocracy, who have found an unexpected sanctuary among the Outcasts. Perhaps you could find the same luck here?

event.name: GUARD_OUTCAST
event.text: The Outcasts have no formal structure, but the sudden epidemic of slavers haunting these sectors has forced them to tighten their security. The guard here eyes you warily, but decides you aren't a threat and keeps their distance.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_GUARD_OUTCAST_CONTACT
textList.text: "These are lands of proud but desolate people. The Federation has not disturbed us in the past - for what reasons have you come now?"
The Outcast captain grunts. "You've hailed. It was my expectations words were not to be exchanged here. Have you got something important to say?"
The captain of the guard vessel strokes the faint patch of moss on her chin and grinds it between her fingers with a mixture of irritation and hesitant curiosity. She awaits your message.

event.text: "Mmmm. There is always something to be spared for brothers and sisters of our people. May you see safe travels through these lands."

choice.text: (Theocracy-Aligned Crew) You are repulsive scum! You do not deserve to share this existence with us.

event.text: The Outcast laughs. "So the Theocracy has finally become bold enough to send its fleet here? We have left your lands peacefully, but if you so choose to cause hell, then let there be hell!"

choice.text: Change your mind and leave the guard alone.

event.text: You apologize and end comms. The guard makes no attempts to communicate further.
"I would prefer we kept our relations with the Federation as were previously settled. Consider the gift of safety in our lands a fair consolation."

"It is unusual for the Federation to come here, and uncharacteristic for them to request aid from a people with little to offer in material. However, I am a believer that good actions are a cycle, and though my brothers and sisters might not agree, I will oblige your request."

"For all the time we have lived in these lands, never once has the Federation made such demands! Why should this day be any different? You insult us with your words, and we are not people who would let such insults go without consequences."

"Careful with your wording. We are peaceful people, yes, but we come from places of great disturbance. I shall choose to ignore your tone and offer this, but take with it this advice. Such aggression will do you no good among my people, and perhaps I am a fool for letting you past."
"There is no place in these lands for 'powerful' men like you who would rather pillage than provide. It is in the name of good that I will strike your vessel down."

"Your people dare so much as call us the barbarians, but it is your actions that prove you are the savages! Had I any less desire to see my brothers and sisters again I wouldn't be so kind as to give in to your disgusting threats."

"Your people dare so much as call us the barbarians, but it is your actions that prove you are the savages! Had I any less desire to see my brothers and sisters again I wouldn't be so kind as to give in to your disgusting threats."

event.name: GUARD_OUTCAST_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Outcast guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_OUTCAST_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Outcast guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You're surprised to find a lone survivor, who pleads with you to spare him. You give in to his request and continue salvaging his ship.

event.name: GUARD_OUTCAST_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Outcast guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_OUTCAST

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: "We pose no threat to you, yet you slaughter us like common pirate filth! You are scum, no better than the Theocracy! This is revenge for our brothers and sisters you killed aboard that guard!"

textList.name: TEXT_START_SHELL
textList.text: You have arrived in a Shell sector. These creatures are distant cousins of the Slugs race, but they lack much of the aggressive and treacherous nature of the Slugs.

You have arrived in a Shell sector. The Shells developed on the same planet as the Slugs, but where the Slugs gained the power to read minds, the Shells evolved to be highly toxic and have a hard exterior.

You have arrived in a Shell sector. The Shells prefer to avoid conflict when they can, and their ships are usually very well protected. Make sure you'll be able to penetrate their defenses before you go trying to fight them.

event.name: GUARD_SHELL_CRIMINAL
event.text: Something seems off here. Usually, the Shells wouldn't bat an eye at ships like yours, but now, you catch suspicious chatter on the guard ship.
It seems your track record has caught up to you. The guard's crew have heard enough of the crimes you've been committing, and they don't intend to let you into the sector!

event.name: GUARD_SHELL
event.text: The Shells value well maintained defenses not only on their ships but their sector as a whole. As such, a guard ship has been deployed to protect the entrance beacon. Fortunately, they don't seem to mind you being here.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_GUARD_SHELL_CONTACT
textList.text: A small Shell appears on the screen, their singular eye locked onto you, waiting.
The Shell captain is surprised to receive a hail from you. Still, he accepts your hail.

event.text: "Ah, welcome back to thhhhe sector. My apologies, I do not often see our kind aboard Federation ships."

choice.text: Change your mind and leave the guard alone.

event.text: You apologize and end comms. The guard makes no attempts to communicate further.
"Sorry, but I cannot give anythhhhhhing." The Shell mutes your ship.
"Sorry, but I cannot give anythhhhhhing." The Shell mutes your ship.
To your surprise, the Shells transfer over some supplies. You wonder if they're doing it out of kindness, or out of fear.
Despite the Shells being known for their 'cowardice', this guard isn't putting up with you. They arm their weapons, and you should do the same.
Fearful of you, the Shells transfer over the supplies willingly.
Despite the Shells being known for their 'cowardice', this guard isn't putting up with you. They arm their weapons, and you should do the same.
Fearful of you, the Shells transfer over the supplies willingly.
Fearful of you, the Shells transfer over the supplies willingly.

event.name: GUARD_SHELL_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Shell guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_SHELL_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Shell guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_SHELL_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Shell guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_SHELL

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: It takes a fair bit to convince the Shells to abandon their timid ways and engage a Federation ship like yours head on, but what else can you expect after you storm into this sector and kill their guard?

event.name: NEBULA_REINFORCEMENTS_SHELL

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: It takes a fair bit to convince the Shells to abandon their timid ways and engage a Federation ship like yours head on, but what else can you expect after you storm into this sector and kill their guard?

event.name: START_SPIDER
event.text: The start beacon to this sector is littered in debris, not even worth salvaging. Data entries in the database seem to say this is a civilian sector, but you don't think this display of destruction is usual in such places. A Militia ship is guarding the entry beacon. "Wh- who the hell are you? This sector is off-entry! Didn't you hear, there's a bunch of damn bugs killing everyone who enters! Get out while you still can."

"What? Yes, but how did you get that name?" He pauses for a moment. "Are you the ship they told me was coming? Thank god, we're getting our asses handed to us. Senator Wright did not prepare the C.D.E.G. for the Brood and we've barely been able to keep the situation under control."

choice.text: We heard there was another Renegade here. What happened?

event.text: "When we realized we didn't have the manpower to take down the Brood AND destroy the G.A.S. Nest we called for backup. Some ex-Clansman named Irwin claimed he was the right pick, but that dumbass went missing a day after we hired him. No one trusted him so we slapped a tracker on his ship, which is how I know he isn't dead. But I don't have the time to track him down. If you could find him and hopefully get his ass back into the fight that'd be great."

"We're about to launch an assault, but we need to ready the Renfield Bombs first. The Brood's lined up all of their defenses and we could use any additional fire support you could offer. I'll transfer the coordinates over to you."
"Nearby there's a trading outpost that'll help get you situated before heading out. Be careful, these giant alien spiders... they're no joke."

event.name: START_SPIDER_QUEST
event.text: "Oh, one last thing. We hired this Clansman guy named Irwin to help kill the spider queen, but he went missing a while ago and we haven't been able to search for him yet. We think he might have been captured or shot down by these fellows who go by the name of the Brood. They're pirates, except they've taken to taming these spiders and using them like weapons! Maybe you could track the bastard down, but be careful. These giant alien spiders... they're no joke."

choice.text: [Federation Database] Read more on the Brood.

textList.name: TEXT_START_REBEL
textList.text: This sector was bustling with activity just a few years ago. Now, more than half of the jump beacons have been destroyed, many settlements have been abandoned and the Rebels patrol constantly.
This sector was hit hard by the rebellion. The many alien settlements and stations located here are now watched over by almost an equal number of Rebel bases, heavy-handedly 'keeping the peace'.
Once the Federation forces were scattered, the Rebels came down hard on the locals here. Between the 'tax collectors' and military bases, the Rebel presence in this sector is high.
At one point this was one of the most commonly travelled sectors. Knowing that, the Rebels have stationed a number of fleets here. Be careful.
You will have to be very cautious in this sector. The Rebels have full control and are no doubt looking for you.

event.name: GUARD_REBEL
event.text: The guard hails you. "Federation scum! I should have known the likes of you would show up on my shift. Don't think the fleet won't hear about this!"
You rush to defensive positions as the guard approaches menacingly.
You hope this is enough to satisfy them...
"Funny, I just can't seem to remember who gave me this scrap... Now hurry along before I change my mind."

choice.text: (Human Crew) Try to persuade them to let you go.
(Engineer Crew) This is a mistake! We are one of you.

event.text: Luckily your Engineer is from Rebel background and convinces the guard the same for the rest of your crew. You're waved through the checkpoint without another word.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Adv Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv Autopilot) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.text: "You cannot fool me! I know you are Federation, I'm not naive enough to fall for your lies!"
"You cannot fool me! I know you are Federation, I'm not naive enough to fall for your lies!"
"Perhaps I am mistaken. Though I doubt you are who you say, I do not wish to suffer punishment from killing a fellow Rebel. You may pass."

event.name: GUARD_REBEL_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Rebel guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_REBEL_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Rebel guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_REBEL_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Rebel guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_REBEL

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: A Rebel ship comes barreling towards you, its entire array of weapons ready to go. You assume this must be the ship sent by the guard to hunt you down and prepare to defend your ship.

textList.name: TEXT_START_AUTO
textList.text: This sector is one of the Automated Rebel Shipyards. It's maintained almost entirely by Auto-ships and a few Rebel engineers.
This sector is one of the Automated Rebel Shipyards. Here it'll be a rare sight to see any organic creatures, and you doubt the Auto-ships will be of much company.
This sector is one of the Automated Rebel Shipyards. All around are scattered scaffolding and Auto-ships, many of which are lying dormant. This won't be like most sectors.

textList.name: TEXT_AUTO_GUARD_MESSAGE
textList.text: You receive a message from the Auto-guard. "This is unit A-786. Your identity: Federation. Federation ships are not permitted to enter this sector. Entering hostile deterrence mode."
You receive a message from the Auto-guard. "Greetings visitor. Unfortunately, it seems you have been identified as a Federation ship. Please do not resist as you are destroyed."

You receive a message from the Auto-guard. "Hello traveller! This is a pre-recorded message for those who enter this sector. Do note that these shipyards are off limit for [all]. Have a nice day!" The Auto-guard's weapons immediately go online.

You receive a message from the Auto-guard. "Your presence has been recorded. It is required of this unit to remove all unauthorized ships from this sector. Do not attempt to flee or damage this unit while the removal process is under-way."

You receive a message from the Auto-guard. "Hello civilian ship. Your interest in this shipyard is greatly appreciated by the Rebellion, but we are afraid that we must inform you that this sector is off-limits. You will now be removed."

event.text: Knowing there is no way around the Auto-guard, you prepare for combat.

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Access the drone's mainframe and disable it.

event.text: Your Engineer shuts off the Auto-guard, allowing you to pass.

choice.text: (Adv Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv Autopilot) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.text: Your attempts at hacking the drone were ineffective. The ship continues its attack.
Your hacking manages to get past the automated ship's mainframe and disable the ship long enough for you to slip past.

event.name: GUARD_AUTO_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Auto-guard. You salvage the remains.

event.name: GUARD_AUTO_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Auto-guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_AUTO

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: "Target found. You are wanted for: destruction of sector guard. Do not resist destruction."

textList.name: TEXT_START_COALITION
textList.text: Every action has an equal and opposite reaction. In this case, the Coalition would be the opposite of the Rebellion. A spiteful and shaky alliance between the 4 most dangerous races in the galaxy with one goal. To eliminate humanity.
The Coalition was a unfortunate side effect of the Slug Expansion wars. Now, they've become another issue for the Federation to deal with.
You've entered a sector controlled by the Coalition. They are no small threat, so watch your step in this sector.
In many ways the Coalition is even more dangerous than the Rebellion themselves. Still, you must push forward and find your way out of this sector in one piece.

event.name: GUARD_COALITION
event.text: You are hailed by the guard. "Heheh, welcome...I hope you intend to pay the fe- wait! You're a Federation ship! Men, arm the guns, we have intruders!"
You rush to defensive positions as the guard approaches menacingly.

choice.text: Offer to pay the fee anyway to be let through.

event.text: You hand over the scrap and hope it's enough to satisfy them...
"Well, scrap does not lie. Go ahead..."

choice.text: (Coalition Allied Crew) Try to persuade them to let you go.

event.text: "I have been... terribly confused. You are a Federation ship, yes? Or... I... Whatever, just leave."

choice.text: (Mind Control) Your Mind Control will not work, as the guard has Slug crew on-board.
(Adv Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv Autopilot) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.name: GUARD_COALITION_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Coalition guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_COALITION_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Coalition guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_COALITION_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Coalition guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_COALITION

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: "We will destroy you Federation scum! You will regret ever coming here!" A hostile Coalition ship approaches, and you suspect they're angry for a lot more than just the dead guard.

textList.name: TEXT_START_ROCK
textList.text: The Rock people have a particularly aggressive stance toward alien races trespassing in their space. You should tread carefully here.
The Rock people are a powerful and proud race. It is not unheard of to have a peaceful journey through their lands, but don't count on it.
Since the re-emergence of the Crystal race, the Rock Government has been in tatters. What this means for your mission, you can't say for certain.

event.name: GUARD_ROCK
event.text: The guard hails you. "You dare intrude on the Elder's holy land? We will destroy you!"
You rush to defensive positions as the guard approaches menacingly.
You hope this is enough to satisfy them...

"We will not be poisoned by your sins! Try as you like, but you will not break our fortitude! Oh... this is a lot of scrap..." The Rockmen briefly wave you through and urge you to hurry before someone spots you.

choice.text: (Rock Crew) Try to persuade them to let you go.
(Crusader Crew) Try to persuade them to let you go.

event.text: The Rockmen would never question the word of a rock crusader. They say nothing further and allow you to pass.

choice.text: (Crystal Crew) Try to persuade them to let you go.

event.text: The Rockmen drop to their knees quivering in fear at the sight of your crew. You knew the Rockmen worshipped the Crystals, but you didn't know it was this extreme. With them distracted, you continue past.

choice.text: (Commando/Outcast Crew) Convince the guards of the Elder's faults.

event.text: As you should have expected, your words have no effect on the Rockmen. They ignore you, continuing their attack.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Adv Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv Autopilot) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.text: "It is not our fault you have distanced yourself from the Elders' words! Your death here is your own doing!"

"I see you have made the mistake of letting yourself stray from the words of the Elders! I am most forgiving, I will give you this one chance to live in hopes you will use it wisely. Best of wishes, brother."

event.name: GUARD_ROCK_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Rock guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_ROCK_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Rock guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_ROCK_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Rock guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_ROCK

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: "Outsiders! The Federation has done enough damage to this galaxy, we do not need you invading our territory and destroying our ways of life! You might have defeated our guard, but your wave of terror ends here!"

textList.name: TEXT_START_DUSKBRINGER
textList.text: The Duskbringers have grown tired of the "peaceful" manner of their leaders, and have adopted a new tactic. All who oppose their ways of life are to be slaughtered. On this list includes the Federation as a whole, so you doubt you'll see many friendly faces here.
This sector is no place for a Federation ship, but fate has brought you here nonetheless. Best to watch out for the Duskbringers, who will no doubt try their hardest to bring about your untimely end.

The Duskbringers are known for their radical ways of dealing with those who disagree with their views on the way the galaxy should be governed. Unless you're willing to surrender to your fascist Zoltan overlords, you'll need to watch your back as you traverse this sector.

event.name: GUARD_DUSKBRINGER
event.text: The guard hails you. "Federation? You are the enemy to a glorious, peaceful future. Your presence here will not be tolerated!"
You rush to defensive positions as the guard approaches menacingly.
You hope this is enough to satisfy them...

"Your desperate, and most certainly pathetic attempts at preserving your lives are recognized. Our glorious future can wait another day, so that we can appreciate the irony that your 'donation' will only be used to fuel this movement further!"

choice.text: (Zoltan Crew) Try to persuade them to let you go.
(Devotee Crew) Halt! We are one of you.

event.text: Your Devotee lies to the guard about your ship and your mission. Though it fortunately works and you're allowed to pass, you have to wonder why your Devotee is helping you.

choice.text: (Radical Crew) Convince the Duskbringers to aid you.

event.text: Your Radical lies to the guard about your ship and your mission. Though it fortunately works and you're allowed to pass, you have to wonder why your Radical is helping you.

choice.text: (Devorak) Convince the Duskbringers to aid you.

event.text: "By the Eye! You carry the great Devorak with you? H-how is this possible? N-no, I dare not question a man so devoted. Please, take everything we can offer. May the Eye see a bright future for your travels."

choice.text: (Mind Control) Your mind control will not work, as the guard's Zoltan Shield is still functional.

event.text: NO

choice.text: (Adv Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv Autopilot) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.text: "You have been poisoned by the Federation's lies! We would sacrifice millions of our own kind in order to take down the Federation, and you are not immune!"
"I pity you, poor creature, who has so clearly been poisoned by the Federation's lies. Though you are ignorant, I shall not harm my own kind. Leave, before I change my mind."

event.name: GUARD_DUSK_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Duskbringer guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_DUSK_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Duskbringer guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_DUSK_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Duskbringer guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_DUSK

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: "You are not wanted here! You have intruded in our territory where you know you are not welcome, and you have killed our guard! Prepare to die!"

textList.name: TEXT_START_MANTIS
textList.text: You've entered a poorly charted area of space that's known to be home to the Mantis. Ensure your hull plating is up to scratch and that you have enough fuel in the tank to make it through.
You've entered a poorly charted area of space that's known to be home to the Mantis. Your crew is told be on alert in case any Mantis or stowaways sneak onboard...
You've entered a poorly charted area of space that's known to be home to the Mantis. You won't find many friendly faces here, or at least not many living ones.

event.name: GUARD_MANTIS
event.text: It's not long before the Suzerain guard spots you. "Meatsacks, this our sector! We kill you!"
You rush to defensive positions as the guard approaches menacingly.
You hope this is enough to satisfy them...
"Ooooh, shiny metals. You bring good gift! You may live."

choice.text: (Mantis Crew) Try to persuade them to let you go.
(Hive Elite) Persuade them to let you go.

event.text: Whether the Mantis still desire to hunt you or not, they would not dare question the authority of an Elite soldier of the Hive. You are allowed to pass.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Adv Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv Autopilot) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

textList.name: TEXT_MANTIS_BRIBE_REJECT
textList.text: The Suzerain reject your bribe. "This many scraps, but is not food! We eat you, no need for money."
The Suzerain reject your bribe. "Hah, stupid Federation captain. He think all creatures in galaxy long for money. No no, we long for blood!"

event.text: The enemy Suzerain spits when he sees your crew. "Traitorous scum! You work on Federation ship, you betray hive!"
"One of Hive work on your ship? Very strange! You must be covert ship. I not interrupt longer."

event.name: GUARD_MANTIS_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Suzerain guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_MANTIS_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Suzerain guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_MANTIS_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Suzerain guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_MANTIS

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: Your computer picks up a conversation on the nearby Mantis ship. "Is them? Yes, those are ones who kill guard!" The Mantis ship swivels to fight you!

textList.name: TEXT_START_GHOST
textList.text: Welcome to Vagabond space. Population? Hard to say - the Ghosts that live here live in disorganized clans, traveling between ships. They're rarely picky over their residency, but a ship like yours would look mighty fine to them...

Tales between travelers often depict these sectors as haunted, riddled with the supernatural. In reality, it's just a bunch of unfortunately named gas beings known as the Ghosts. They certainly aren't spirits of the dead, but the Vagabonds hold no allegiance to anyone.

Anywhere else, a pile of scrap makes a good bribe to keep most foes off your back. This isn't the case here. The Vagabonds could care less about scrap, they just want your ship. And that's something you aren't willing to give up.

event.text: The Vagabond clans don't always agree with each other, so it's not too surprising to see no ship is protecting this sector. The same unconfrontational behavior should not be expected of the rest of this sector's inhabitants.

Looks like the Vagabond clans were able to appoint a ship to keep guard - or maybe they're just here by coincidence. All the same, a Ghost filled wreck is here and they aren't interested in letting you in.
You rush to defensive positions as the guard approaches menacingly.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Adv Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv Autopilot) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.name: GUARD_GHOST_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Vagabond ship. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_GHOST_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Vagabond ship. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_GHOST_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the makeshift Vagabond guard, you've probably upset the other clans here. They probably won't be so pleased with you after this.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_GHOST

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: The Vagabonds usually don't work together, but it's in their best interest not to let random ships come in and claim their territory. Looks like a ship here wants to avenge the guard by killing you!

event.name: START_GHOSTWASTE
event.text: The stories of this sector still fascinate you to this day. Long long before the Federation, this was once ruled by the Spectral Dynasty. But from nowhere, some mysterious force wiped practically every Ghost in this sector from existence. You wish you could ask the Ghosts themselves what went down, but you know that'll never happen...

event.name: GUARD_GHOSTWASTE
event.text: Looks like the Dynasty still has a guard lying around, probably to keep scavengers or Vagabonds out of their stuff. Your translator struggles to pick up their static vocals for a moment, but eventually pulls through. "This sector is not for visitation. Go somewhere else, breather. The Dynasty needs not the Federation intervention you seek to provide."
You rush to defensive positions as the guard approaches menacingly.
You hope this is enough to satisfy them...
"You bring pleasant offerings. The jingle of a better pay rings in my ears. Hand it over, and vanish from my sight as fast as your vessel will allow."

choice.text: (Phantom Crew) Try to persuade them to let you go.
(Alpha Phantom Crew) Persuade them to let you go.

textList.name: TEXT_START_PIRATE
textList.text: A few years ago this region was bustling with trade activity. Now it is overrun with bandits and marauders. You should tread lightly here.

This somewhat isolated region was thrown into chaos at the start of the rebellion. Even in peacetime it was always beset by pirates but now it houses a center of operations for countless pirate fleets.
If the reports are true, this area has been under the control of pirates for quite some time. Some traders still attempt to trade with the few settlements that remain, but they do so at great risk.
A few Federation-friendly planets still exist in this sector, but they are constantly under attack by pirate raids. This is a dangerous sector, so be careful.

event.name: GUARD_PIRATE
event.text: You are immediately 'greeted' by the guard. "Greetings friends! Welcome to our sector. I'm sure you're aware that there is a fee for entry..."

choice.text: We refuse to pay the fee, fight your way through!

event.text: You mute the ship and prepare for combat.
"Have a wonderful day!" The pirate captain chuckles and starts counting your scrap.

textList.name: TEXT_START_SLUG
textList.text: The only thing that can render a nebula more dangerous is if it's also home to the Slugs. This particular nebula is just that.
This nebula is home to the telepathic Slugs. They'd sell their own slime for a crate of scrap, but they much prefer to just take it.
You're told the Slug live somewhere in this nebula. You can't see them, but you know they're watching.

The Slugs that live in this nebula field are a leisure-centered civilization. Everything in Slug life is done in the pursuit of more currency and more time in which to spend it on extravagant ventures. This, inevitably, leads to much treachery in open space.

The Slugs developed on an ocean planet where the ability to telepathically sense another organism was more important than sight. Today they use this ability to navigate unfettered the depths of the nebulas they inhabit.

event.name: GUARD_SLUG
event.text: You are immediately "welcomed" by the Slugs. "Thissss is our home. I hope you intend to pay the sssstandard fee."

choice.text: We refuse to pay the fee, fight your way through!

event.text: You mute the ship and prepare for combat.
"Ssssmart choiccce!" The Slug Captain ends the call.

textList.name: TEXT_START_LEECH
textList.text: Leech society is in tatters, and their government in a constant state of upheaval. Hopefully the government doesn't collapse while you're here and you can make it out the other end safely.

Some observers have begun to refer to Leech sectors as the forgotten fronts, and for good reason. A major war is underway here, but compared to the chaos of the Multiverse war, few are interested in these events. Let's just hope they won't get in your way.

The entry to this sector alone is littered with junk barely suitable for a Flak cannon in all directions. You've heard stories of the state of utter disrepair that these sectors are in, but this still comes as a shock. What else could await you here?

event.name: GUARD_LEECH
event.text: Leech security in recent times has gotten more and more lax. So busy handling the threat of Alkram's revolution, the Kraterocracy can barely react to foreign intruders. This is good news for you - you should be able to get by without being bothered.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

event.name: GUARD_LEECH_INTERACT
event.text: The Leech ship ignores you entirely. They're either napping, or just don't care.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

event.name: GUARD_LEECH_COALITION
event.text: Unfortunately, there's no Leech guard here this time. Looks like a Coalition ship has been put in charge of protecting this sector, and they aren't going to let you past easily!
You rush to defensive positions as the guard approaches menacingly.

choice.text: Offer to pay the fee anyway to be let through.

event.text: You hand over the scrap and hope it's enough to satisfy them...
"Well, scrap does not lie. Go ahead..."

choice.text: (Coalition Allied Crew) Try to persuade them to let you go.

event.text: "I have been... terribly confused. You are a Federation ship, yes? Or... I... Whatever, just leave."

textList.name: TEXT_START_DYNASTY
textList.text: The Dynasty is one of the oldest running known civilizations on record, possibly longer than even the Lanius or Crystals. Somewhere in the timeline a massive chunk of their territory was simply... erased, and no one but the Ghosts know why. And they certainly aren't telling.

The Ghosts are biological mysteries, and so is much of the Dynasty's history. Maybe if they weren't so busy blaming the Federation for the Rebellion, they'd actually calm down and explain. But what are the chances of that?

According to the database, it looks like the Rebels have dispatched numerous Auto-ships to these sectors as part of some weird war against the Dynasty. Hopefully you can stay out of the crossfires as much as necessary.
The Dynasty isn't particuarly friendly to the Federation. They seem to have bunched them in along with the Rebels as 'bad men.' Maybe you can break this stereotype? Probably not, but one can dream...

event.name: GUARD_DYNASTY
event.text: A burst of Ghost static blasts through your ship. "The Federation knows it is not welcome to intrude on these fair lands. Expect not to leave without a skirmish, you fiend!"
You rush to defensive positions as the guard approaches menacingly.
You hope this is enough to satisfy them...
"You bring pleasant offerings. The jingle of a better pay rings in my ears. Hand it over, and vanish from my sight as fast as your vessel will allow."

choice.text: (Phantom Crew) Try to persuade them to let you go.
(Alpha Phantom Crew) Persuade them to let you go.

event.text: "There exists no mercy in hell, so shant I not give it here? Cause erupt a mighty panic if allowing any of yours through these gates! One of us or not, you see not a glint of care in mine eyes!"
"It is far from protocol to allow the passing of any vessel bearing the Federation banner. Yet, your crew makes me question your interest in bringing harm to my people. Do not make me regret this."

event.name: START_HACKED
event.text: This appears to be an ordinary Civilian sector, but something has gone wrong with the entrance beacon. Your computer is overloaded by strange signals and garbled static occasionally can be heard from your radio system.

event.name: GUARD_HACKED
event.text: Strangely, there is no Militia guard protecting this beacon. Instead, a civilian outpost in the distance hails you. "Y..yes. Hello. We are... we are requesting that you pay the mandator... the mandatory fee for entry. Please."

choice.text: What? Since when have we had to pay a fee to enter a civilian sector?

event.text: A hacker ship uncloaks nearby. "Thankssss for your patronage! Enjoy the ssssector!"

choice.text: (Upg. Engines) Try to dodge the fee.
(Adv. Engines) Try to dodge the fee.

event.text: You speed past the Civilian outpost. A hacker ship uncloaks and tries to stop you, but you're too fast and leave them far behind.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Your Slug senses distress among the civilians. He advises we arm the weapons.

event.text: Noticing your silence, an impatient hacker ship uncloaks nearby. "Damn you, traitoroussss Sslug! One of our kind, working on a Federation vessssel? Heresssy!"
The civilians stutter, not sure how to respond. A hacker ship uncloaks nearby, its entire arsenal aimed at you. "Sssscrew thisss, thesse onessss asssk too many quesssstionss."
"We-we are getting word from our s-superiors. They're s-saying.. that the price... can be l-lowered..."
A hacker ship uncloaks nearby. "You Fedsss are jusssst too ssstubborn to play along, aren't you?"
As you're attempting to flee, a Hacker ship uncloaks and stops you! "You cannot run from ussss captain! We will get our ssscrap one way or another." Scans show they've disrupted the engines!
The Anti-Virus works its magic and counters the digital assault without any problems.
The Hacker ship's virus is much harder to purge than you expected, and you have to overclock the hacking system. Your engines return to normal, but your hacking has taken a huge loss.

You fly past the civilian outpost. They make no attempt to stop you, though a hacker ship uncloaks and trys to block you. You collide with their hull, taking minor damage, but continue on your path, leaving them behind in the dust.

event.name: GUARD_HACKED_WIN
event.text: You've defeated the hacker ship. You salvage what remains of their ship.

The Civilian outpost hails you again. "Thank you for saving us! The hackers swarmed this sector, they shut off all of our communications and killed our entire fleet of militiamen! They've been keeping us as slaves and using this sector as their base of operations. Now that we're free, there's no better opportunity for me to escape than to hitch a ride on your ship."

textList.name: TEXT_START_ABANDONED
textList.text: This sector was once a busy civilian sector, but the Federation Civil War has hit it hard. Rebel forces drove out most of the civilian populace, leaving way for new visitors, many unwelcome.

This sector was the site of many major battles between the Federation and Rebel fleets. Brief vague entries in the database suggest the sector has been taken up by a combination of Ghosts, Lanius, and Pirates.

True to its designation on the map, this sector has been primarily abandoned by the civilians who once populated it. Now, scavengers and pirates roam the systems, searching for the easy pickings left behind.
The war tore through this civilian sector, leaving behind large wrecks and abandoned infrastructure, a perfect haven for the likes of scavengers.

event.text: It's of no surprise that no guard ship is protecting this beacon. You have some time on your hands to do something on the ship.
It appears a single Militia guard has been dispatched here to try and defend against scavengers.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

event.name: GUARD_ABANDONED_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Militia guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_ABANDONED_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Militia guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_ABANDONED_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Militia guard, there is no longer a ship to protect this sector. It's likely more ships will be able to leak through now.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_ABANDONED

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: A pirate ship approaches, brandishing its weapons. "You're the fellow who killed that guard ship, ain't you? Well you did us a favor letting us in, and now we're gonna repay it by stealing all your scrap!"

textList.name: TEXT_START_NEBULA
textList.text: This nebula must have been an important hub at one point; placing all of these jump beacons would be no easy task. However, now it's hardly navigable.
Nebulas were always dangerous places. Many electronics fail in these clouds. You will have to tread lightly.
You've entered a sector thick with nebulas. You'll have to navigate on instinct.
You've entered a nebula-rich sector. You may put a few light years on the fleet, but that's only useful if you make it out the other side.
Thanks to the high nebula density of this sector very little of it has been charted, and rumours of what lurks in the depths abound.
The gases that make up the nebulas in this sector threaten to impair your systems; but you have to press on.

event.name: START_NEBULA_INFO
event.text: You glance nervously at the sector map. Though the Rebels will struggle to track you here, it seems the location of the Exit beacon was never specified! You'll have to do some exploring until you're adjacent to it for the computer to recognize it.

event.name: START_COREWORLDS
event.text: You have entered the Civilian Coreworlds, a well protected Civilian sector, and home to the Galactic Union, and as such many important political figures from all over the galaxy. Just go about your business and don't try anything shifty, and you should be fine.

event.name: GUARD_CIVILIAN_COREWORLDS
event.text: You're immediately hailed by the guard. "This is a vital sector to the Galactic Union which makes up the Civilian representation of the Federation. We must run a full background check and scan of your ship to allow you through." As you are already a Federation vessel, you should have no difficulty getting past.

After long last you make your way to the checkpoint entrance. Your crew are taken one by one into a full-room scanning machine that examines everything from their chemical makeup to the contents of their stomach. Your crew might be a makeshift crew of all kinds, but the Militiamen don't seem to care and you're allowed to pass.

After long last you make your way to the checkpoint entrance. Your crew are taken one by one into a full-room scanning machine that examines everything from their chemical makeup to the contents of their stomach. There's some trouble where they think your Symbiote is trying to smuggle in a Zoltan refugee, but after you try to explain the complciated situation they just give up and let them through. The rest of your crew might be a makeshift crew of all kinds, but the Militiamen don't seem to care and you're all allowed to pass.

choice.text: Forget the inspection, attack the checkpoint!

event.text: You could have easily gotten past the checkpoint, but instead you have decided to attack.

choice.text: (Soldier Crew) Submit your Federation ID quickly and request repairs.

event.text: It doesn't take long for your Soldier to get you though security, and with a little extra negotiation convinces the Militia ships to patch up your hull.

event.text: You have entered the Engi Harmony Sector, the original homeworlds of the Engi race. Luckily Engi are known for their peaceful nature, but just make sure they don't catch you doing anything illegal.

event.name: GUARD_HARMONY
event.text: The Engi guard almost immediately notices you. "This sector is under quarantine, protection from Rebellion and Mantis forces critical. Identity, Federation? Identification proof required to permit entry. ID will no longer suffice. Additional verification; proof of peaceful ways or truce with Engi."
"Error 553. Ship has turned hostile. Failure to pass verification results in: removal from Sector. Do not resist."

event.text: "Engi aboard ship: suggests low desire to harm fellow Engi. Verification: Granted. Ship will be allowed to pass."

event.text: "Upgraded medical unit, suggests medical utility: beneficial for all. Verification: Granted. Ship will be allowed to pass."

choice.text: (Med-Bots) Show them your Med-Bots as proof.

event.text: "Dual purpose recognized. Med-bots, both sign of acceptance of Engi technology, as well as medical usage. Verification: Granted. Ship will be allowed to pass."

choice.text: (Support Weapon) Show them your equipment as proof.

event.text: "Non-harmful weapon recognized. Suggests ulterior motives to destruction of Engi ships. Verification: Granted. Ship will be allowed to pass."

event.name: START_CAPITAL
event.text: You've arrived in the Zoltan Capital, the home of the Zoltan Minister. The Zoltan government claims to be a unified Republic who promote peace and prosperity all around the galaxy, but behind closed doors corrupt aristocrats play puppet-master. Though they joined the Federation long ago, tensions between the two governments have been wearing thin.

event.name: GUARD_ZOLTAN_CAPITAL
event.text: The guard ship here hails you. "Your arrival has been recorded. Please provide your reason for entry, as well as proof to verify your claim.

choice.text: (Engi Crew/Nano-bots) This is a peaceful Engi operated vessel.

event.text: The Zoltan looks down at a clipboard for a long time. "Your response has been deemed satisfactory. You may continue."

You know that you have a Slug on-board, but you agreed to the scan anyways. The Shell ship quickly identifies your Slug crew. "You are smuggling a Slug aboard your ship! Damn it, hurry to thhhe weapons!"
You've decided to ignore any possibility of a peaceful resolution, and turn to destroying the Shell ship immediately.
