event.text: This sector is supposedly home to the Shell Geniocracy's finest scientists and where their primary genetic research is performed. However, the strange Atlas entry here leads you to assume something is up...

Over your radio blares a brief section from the Geniocracy anthem, followed by a distressed pre-recorded message. "This is Professor Alkali, lead research and spearhead of the Geniocracy science district and genetic enhancement project. If you are hearing this, I advise leaving as soon as possible. My team and I are currently locked in Lab Omega. We made a terrible mistake... our latest creations, the Morphs, they've gone loose. Worse yet, the Rebellion has arrived from unspecified regions. This sector is not safe. I repeat, this sector is not sa-" The message is cut off as a distant shadow approaches, revealing itself to be a ship!

event.name: GUARD_MORPH
event.text: Before you is a Shell guard, though it's of highly unusual colors. A flat, unfaltered gray hull sets it apart from their usual appearance. Even more peculiar, the ship hails you, speaking complete nonsense. "Speke eek! Yip yoo, urple roo. Kip kip too roo, sploo purp jook!" A small grey blob shows up on your screen, making odd spastic gestures with its body.
It seems whatever these Morphs are, they haven't taken kindly to you ignoring them, and open fire!
"BIK BIK, TALA TALA TOOLA TOOLA! OBOT RIPPLE DUE!" Whatever the hell that means, it seems the Morphs aren't willing to talk. Get ready for a fight!

choice.text: (Morph Crew) Kik kik, urgl yoo too!

"I see you do not fear our weapons! I'd call you a fool, but I think that has already been established by you coming here."
"I see you know very well that you can't hide from us!"
"So you wish to be rendered a sitting duck? I can't say I agree with your choice, but who am I to judge a dead man?"

event.text: This is the capital of the Spectral Dynasty. This ancient faction of Phantoms has been on a path of war lately, which has led them directly into conflict with the Rebellion. Why they're so aggressive - and their sectors littered with ruins - is still a mystery to the Federation.

event.name: GUARD_DYNCAP
event.text: Looks like the ship protecting the entrance is a Reaper vessel - one of the guardians chosen by Dessius the Prime Reaper himself. They hail you - "The Federation is not permitted within that of Dynasty lands. Speak your business and we will see if you are deserving of an exception. Choose your words poorly, and you will face certain death."

choice.text: We seek asylum from the Rebels in your sector.

event.text: "You speak nonsense. Did you gather nothing from the databases surely provided to you by your Federation? These lands are ravaged by the Rebellion's demons. You speak only lies, and I wish not hear them any longer."

choice.text: We wish to learn the customs and history of your people.

event.text: "What, of our collapsing society and the lifeless wastes of times long past? I could hardly relate. All the same, if you speak the truth, then present your tourism permit with official stampage from Dessius himself."

choice.text: Ah yes, about my uh... permit.

event.text: "I am to assume this means you do not wield one? Then you should already know that entry will not be permitted. Enough wasting of my time."
"T-this is not a pass. This is but mere scrap metal. O-oh. I see now. I shall, erm, take this offer, but request that you make your flight through these lands fast before I have time to regret it."
"Yes, this pass is most serviceable. Please proceed."

The two Ghosts converse back and forth in their native language - a mixture of static and shrill ticks. Eventually the guard speaks again. "Your identification has been approved. I give my most sincere apologies for the misunderstanding. May the lights of good fortune forever shine on the Dynasty." The guard offers some supplies.

event.text: You have arrived in the newly founded homeworlds of the Crystalline race. event.name: GUARD_CRYSTALHOME
event.text: The guard hails you, and while their captain's face is featureless as always, their tone suggests they would be wearing a frown. "Blagh, more aliens? It is like you foreigners have a death-wish!"

choice.text: Try to talk it out with them.

event.name: START_LOSTSUN
event.text: This sector appears to be the stronghold of the Lost Suns, formidable rock warriors who rebelled against their tyrannical government. Bittersweet allies with the Federation, the Lost Suns themselves shouldn't be too hostile towards you, but don't expect a warm welcome.

event.name: GUARD_LOSTSUN
event.text: Three fortified stations and a squadron of heavily armored guards protect the entry beacon. It doesn't take long until they notice you. "Federation ship, your presence here is noted. What is your business in our sector?"

"An unfortunate truth that our sector often serves as a unwelcome connection between neighbouring sectors. You must wait here for an inspection and pay a fee, and we will deem if you are worthy to pass."

choice.text: Agree to the fee and inspection.

event.text: The inspection is long and arduous, but goes through without a hitch. "I see nothing of concern aboard your ship. But be warned, Federation captain. You might support our efforts, but we all know your motivation. An end to the Rock government is as beneficial to you as it is to us. Should we have a different target, your thoughts of our mission might not be so gracious."

"I see you are too cheap to pay for the potential threat you bring to our sector. Or perhaps you have something to hide, or that your motives are not simply to pass through as you say? It matters not, you will be dead soon."

choice.text: We wish to use this sector as a rest from the Rebel threat.

event.text: "Bah, you are ignorant if you think this sector is safe from their control. Your presence here will surely bring the fleet, which will doom us all! If you wish to travel through here unharmed, you must give us your flight plans, so that the Rebels might pass through quickly in pursuit of you."

choice.text: Agree to giving them your flight plans.

event.text: You know this will accelerate the fleet by a dangerous rate, but you have little other options. "I hope you know, that should the Rebellion purge this sector as it has to so many others because of your foolishness, our thankfulness for the Federation will quickly fade."

"So you are one of those pathetic creatures who thinks all those around him are beneath him, and deserving of the consequences of his petty whims? We shall teach you a lesson, and cleanse you from this world in the holy fire!"

choice.text: We have heard the legends of your resistance, and wish to learn more.

event.text: "You think we are naive? Stupid enough to believe you come here in search of knowledge? You are a military ship, bearing guns and the Federation sign. We do not appreciate lies. If you wish to safely pass, you must hand over a portion of your ammunition and droneparts."

"No surprise, men of war are often too attached to their silly playthings of destruction. We have seen many people like you, and now we will make there be one less."

choice.text: You don't have time for explanations. Fight your way through!

event.name: START_BLACKMARKET
event.text: This is no ordinary pirate sector. Far from Federation jurisdiction, this is the heart of the black market, and the Smuggler clan's operations. Ships of all kinds come here, with an endless spectrum of motivations. You never know what you may find here, for better or for worse...

event.name: GUARD_BLACKMARKET
event.text: An incredibly well armed ship of originally Rebel design, marked in Smuggler pirate, is guarding the entry beacon. They demand you pass a quick inspection or pay a fee before you may enter. You've never seen this model of ship before, but they've got a large artillery cannon pointed right at you!
The smugglers don't look surprised at all, as if this was a usual occurrence. You hurry to arm the weapons.
"Ah, got something to hide? Well, scrap is scrap..."

choice.text: (Adv Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv Autopilot) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.text: You hold your breath in anticipation, but the smugglers briefly inspect only your crew. "Federation personnel, huh?" Your heart beats faster, but the smuggler just laughs. "Hey now, I'm not one to judge. I'll let you through, all are welcome here, long as you ain't on the blacklist."

You move past the auto-ship.
It might be small, but any portion of scrap you can get will help.

event.text: Even after closing your Atlas, the torrent of advertisements doesn't stop. Just about every product imaginable is shilled to you in under a minute. You finally resort to muting the ship's radio so you can hear yourself think again.

choice.text: Thanks - wait, did you just call us debtors?

Didn't you know that every U.W.U. point you collect comessss with a fee of 500 ssscrap? Yesssir, you now owe ussss a total of 2500 ssscrap! Quite the predicament..."

choice.text: Well, what do we do about it?

event.text: "Oh that'sss quite sssimple. You pay it, or you ssstay here forever. Don't worry if you do end up ssstaying, Hektar Indussstriessss sssellsss just about everything you need to live a painfully adequate life of a minimum wage worker! Good luck!"

choice.text: Surely there's SOMETHING we can do!

event.text: The Slug laughs. "Yeah, ssssure. You could go track down Mr. Billy Hektar himssself and asssk for your debt to be cleared! Hah, get real."
This is criminal! If the Federation isn't aware about this, then you'll have to take matters into your own hands, starting with this ship.
The guard waves you goodbye as you distance yourself.
